{{Infobox website | name = | logo = [[Image:OldVersion.com logo.png|190px|Logo.]] | screenshot = | collapsible = | collapsetext = | caption = | url = [http://oldversion.com OldVersion.com] | alexa = {{increase}} 34,447 ({{as of|2011|11|2|alt=November 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/OldVersion.com |title= Oldversion.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> | commercial = | type = Freeware/shareware archive of old software versions | language = English | registration = Optional (to post on forum). | owner = | author = Alex Levine, Igor Dolgalev | launch date = May 31, 2001<ref>[http://who.godaddy.com/WhoIs.aspx?domain=oldversion.com&prog_id=godaddy Oldversion.com Whois record]. ''godaddy.com''. Retrieved 2010-07-04.</ref> | current status = | revenue = | slogan = Because newer is not always better | content license = }} '''OldVersion.com''' is an [[archive]] [[website]] that stores and distributes [[legacy system|older versions]] of primarily [[Internet]]-related [[IBM PC compatible|PC]] and [[Apple Macintosh|Macintosh]] [[freeware]] and [[shareware]] [[application software]]. Alex Levine and Igor Dolgalev<ref name="NYTDiary"/> founded the site in 2001.<!-- WSJ says OV is a "New site" and the article date=2001, so.--><ref name="WSJ">{{cite news |url=http://online.wsj.com/public/article/SB114117101940985905-tMpK9H381GBBvXAp6u1kNj1URxo_20070306.html?mod=tff_main_tff_top |title=Unhappy Upgrades: Software Users Seek Help 'Downgrading' Their PCs |author=Andrew Lavallee |date=2006-03-07 |publisher=[[Wall Street Journal]] |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref>
Levine created the site because "Companies make a lot of new versions. They're not always better for the consumer." As reported in the Wall Street Journal, " 'Users often try to downgrade when they find confusing changes in a new version or encounter software bugs, or just decide they want to go back to a more familiar version,' said David Smith, an analyst at research firm Gartner. 'Often, they discover that the downgrade process is complicated, if not impossible.' "<ref name="WSJ"/>
When OldVersion.com was launched it offered 80 versions of 14 programs.<ref name="NYTDiary">{{cite web|author=Pamela LiCalzi O'Connell |url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9402E6D81139F93BA35752C1A9679C8B63&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=print |title=Online Diary - Oldies but Goodies |publisher=[[New York Times]] |date=2001-11-08 |accessdate=2009-06-29}}</ref> By 2005 over 500 versions were posted.<ref>{{cite book| title=PCs: The Missing Manual |page=536 |author=[[Andy Rathbone]] |publisher=Pogue Press |date= 2005-12-23 |isbn= 0596100930 |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=NvYlz7YlCAwC&pg=PA536&dq=oldversion.com&hl=en&ei=ZaMwTNqfD-fnnQf-vpD3Aw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCsQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=oldversion.com&f=false | accessdate=2010-07-04}}</ref> By 28 August 2007 this had grown to 2388 versions of 179 programs, in categories such as "graphics", "file-sharing", "security" and "enterprise".<ref name="OV2007">{{cite web | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20070828202817/http://oldversion.com/ |archivedate=2007-08-28 |title=Oldversion.com as of 2007-08-28| work=oldversion.com | accessdate=2008-03-01}}</ref><ref name="PCMAG2008">{{cite web |author= Jennifer L. DeLeo |date=2008-10-20| url=http://www.pcmag.com/print_article2/0,1217,a=233135,00.asp?hidPrint=true |title=Old Software Versions We Want Back |publisher=[[PC Magazine]] |accessdate=2010-07-04}}</ref><!--3rd party cite for growth figures--> The site also carries 600+ versions of 35 [[Macintosh]] programs.<ref>[http://mac.oldversion.com Mac.OldVersion.com website] ''mac.oldversion.com''. Retrieved 2010-07-04.</ref>
''[[PC World (magazine)|PC World]]'' has labeled the site "a treasure trove ... of older-but-better software";<ref name="PCW">{{cite news |url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/id,137703/article.html |title=Before They Spoiled the Software |author=Preston Gralla |date=2007-09-30 |publisher=[[PC World (magazine)|PC World]] |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref> the ''[[National Review]]'' calls OldVersion.com a "champion" for "software conservatives".<ref name="Genauer">{{cite news |title=Older Is Better: Software conservatives have a home in Oldversion.com |url=http://www.nationalreview.com/comment/genauer200503280737.asp |author=Rami Genauer |date=2005-03-28 |publisher=[[National Review]] |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref>
